Hey, Tim, I heard what you said about negativity online and the accountability (lack of it) for poor behavior and comments. I absolutely agree with your feelings about anonymity and cancel-culture. I support any ways that accountability can be enhance. Own your words and behaviors.
I'm sorry that others have been unkind and disrespectful, especially since you actually do a high quality job, and continue to make lots of concepts and really cool ideas accessible to laymen like me. Please know many of us see your hard work, and appreciate it.
For your own protection/well-being, when you experience that negativity... perhaps you can "be a duck." They can get in fights/conflict, but as soon as it's over, they'll flap their wings, shake their head and tail, releasing that "conflict energy" and then sail through the water calmly. We benefit from your good work. Cheers!

dude, I don't really get it as long as a video had a 95% positive like to dislike ratio, the vast majority of people obviously thought it was a good video. So what does it matter if 5% of people dislike a video, yeah when you are getting 2.1 million views 5% is like lot people, but you have to have a sense of scale when it comes to that, it is still only 5% of people and pleased the vast majority of people and you can't pleas every body, even if it's 0.1% people of 2.1 million that is still going to be 2,100 potentially nit picking you in the comments, but you pleased ‭2,097,900‬ people and some people are just asses.


So every time you read a comment that nit picks just look back at the like to dislike ratio and realize this person is and exception of an exception, not only are they someone who maybe disliked the video, they were someone who felt strongly enough about it to comment about it, so they are like the 0.01% and you I would hope that would help to disregard it even if it is repeated because they are the exception.

Youtube trolls aren't really new territory, just a new version of the mouthy kid in the back of class seeking attention. We have them with email chains, chat forums, news forums, etc. Even "protesters" shouting from the sidewalk of doctors or senators homes.


Unfortunately, until society finds anonymous bids for attention as distasteful as tagging private property, it's going to just keep happening. Maybe Youtube can create the equivalent of closed windows for when the neighborhood punk drives by with the car stereo desperately trying to get attention. Like I tell my kids, your freedom stops where it begins taking away others freedoms.

I mean knowing a name or not.. if a troll is on the other side of the world, what does it actually matter knowing their name.. even with their verified name ppl are not going to feel accountable.. If a comment hurts you, just think:"Did I F this up, or is this guy (the troll) just an idiot." In 99% of the cases you'd have to draw the conclusion the troll is an idiot. And thus it doesn't matter what they say.. Drew this conclusion from 12 years being bullied in school.. It actually works..
Bullies exist, that's why I think trolls are even going to be there when names are taken and verified, .. Bullies names are known in the community, they are local, most of the time you even know where they live... and they're still not feeling accountable...
You should just find a way in which you can ignore idiots. See a stupid comment just laugh at their stupidity in stead of being hurt by it. It''s not you it's them... ;)

Sending men to mars is an act of stupidity. We can't afford the price and never ending supply chain. Use robots for now and in another 100 to 500 years we will have the technology and financial resources. Unless of course a Democrat gets elected, the  you can pretend by sitting in a cardboard box.

I enjoy your videos so much. Takes me back to a previous lifetime where I worked for The Aerospace Corporation (Space Science Labs) and Geospace Research. I designed computer systems and software for data taking during experiments. Got out into the field a lot. Only got to a few launches, though. There was a SCUD launch out of Wallops Island and there is nothing like experiencing sound as pure vibration. It was so exciting. Did a lot of USAF & NASA sponsored research. I work in a very different field now, and feel that I was born to do what I'm doing. Still get nostalgic for the old days, though, and your videos help feed that part of me that used to get excited.

Elon Reeve Musk é um empreendedor, filantropo e visionário sul-africano-canadense-americano. Ele é o fundador, CEO e CTO da SpaceX; CEO da Tesla Motors; vice-presidente da OpenAI; fundador e CEO da Neuralink; e co-fundador e presidente da SolarCity. Este homem será o responsável por salvar milhares de pessoas. A Nasa vem a anos estudando pra explorar um planeta e chega Elon Reeve Musk em pouco tempo já conseguiu reaproveitar  seus foguetes de lançamentos. Fazendo com isso a viabilidade de exploração deixar de ser um sonho e tornar realidade. Hoje estou aqui escrevendo a minha opinião sobre esta  realidade. Elon Reeve Musk você vai passar por várias  barreiras, mas nenhuma delas serão o suficiente para que façam desistir dos outros planetas. No universo existe sim vida além de nós. Podem ser iguais ou diferente de nós, mas isso não importa o objetivo e migrar para outro planeta porque o nosso aos poucos esta se modificando com os passar dos anos. Não podemos dormir e esperar que tudo sempre continue como esta a cada dia que passa modificações acontecem. Precisamos buscar outro caminho além das estrelas. Neste imenso universo existe sim vida igual a nossa sim! Apesar de que algumas pessoas defendam que isso é impossível. Você Elon Reeve Musk acredita que existe vida em outros planetas? Então acompanho sempre seus passos sou super fã admiro sua coragem em perder seu tempo precioso em busca de uma solução para humanidade. Quero lhe agradecer e lhe dizer que você vai encontrar o que procura em breve neste universo imenso. A humanidade só tem a lhe agradecer por nos ajudar. Talvez eu e você Elon Reeve Musk não estaremos aqui pra ver a conquista espacial no futuro. Mas estaremos na história eu Luiz Paulek por escrever esta carta a você Elon Reeve Musk por conquistar o espaço e salvar a espécie humana. Bom meu amigo Elon desejo todo sucesso do mundo a você e nunca desista vá em frente. Precisamos de você lembra disso. No. You are posting public videos for public consumption and PROFIT, VIEWS and YOUR INTERESTS are your motives. The consequences for seekinging views/profit are constructive and destructive comments and everything else that comes along with it. You should have your cake and eat it too. You chose to not be anonymous. You could post videos and not show yourself or your identity. I didn't choose to be public. Just like all of this is interesting but, 99.999% of racketeering is for profit. Manned Mars travel is for marketing and ego. The Earth is becoming almost uninhabitable for humans and money must be spent on Mars? It's how you get money...excitement and ego. (In regards to space exploration) I'm all for space exploring but, humanity is not a priority, (Besides there being too many humans in my opinion) doing something just to do it is a priority. If 1% of all technology was spent on health humans and other organisms, life would be tremendously more supported on Earth. The Earth doesn't feel, organisms do. It's not save the Earth or the whales etc., it's save those from humans and for humans. The vast majority if your audience is interested in what you post, so most are similarly minded. You will rarely see someone who couldn't care less comment or even watch one of your videos. I find them interesting and entertaining. That's what these channels are for. Everything on the internet is public. You chose to lose your anonymity (should be pronounced correctly) when you posted your first video. I did too just commenting anything but, in a more limited fashion. That's why I'm not going to profit. I chose that and you did too.

Commercials, links to merchandise and Patreon in this video just alone.

Hi Tim.  I agree that if you find some comments insulting you should know who your antagonist (as you feel/see it) is.  But I think you should have a way to demand that knowledge in some defined way.  By 'defined' here I mean some specific request (like an email address + real name perhaps?) that you make to converse with that commenter.  If there's a response that you deem acceptable, then you can have a dialogue with that person that's satisfying to you.  If it's not satisfying, or there is no adequate response to your request, then block that person from commenting further if you wish.  That's definitely your right and if it makes your work more pleasant, it would be a good thing.
